alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Nicholas, southeastern Kanawha, northern Raleigh, southwestern Clay, Fayette and east central Boone Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawks Nest State Park, or near Fayetteville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Mount Hope, Ansted, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Powellton, Glen, Hawks Nest State Park, Craigsville, Burnwell and Bradley. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 53 and 81. Route 19 between mile markers 4 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
